name: mapreduce.map.maxattempts
description:
Expert: The maximum number of attempts per map task.
  In other words, framework will try to execute a map task these many number
  of times before giving up on it.

name: dfs.storage.policy.satisfier.work.multiplier.per.iteration
description:
*Note*: Advanced property. Change with caution.
    This determines the total amount of block transfers to begin in
    one iteration, for satisfy the policy. The actual number is obtained by
    multiplying this multiplier with the total number of live nodes in the
    cluster. The result number is the number of blocks to begin transfers
    immediately. This number can be any positive, non-zero integer.

name: dfs.datanode.cache.revocation.polling.ms
description:
How often the DataNode should poll to see if the clients have
    stopped using a replica that the DataNode wants to uncache.

name: dfs.datanode.transfer.socket.recv.buffer.size
description:
Socket receive buffer size for DataXceiver (receiving packets from client
    during block writing). This may affect TCP connection throughput.
    If it is set to zero or negative value, no buffer size will be set
    explicitly, thus enable tcp auto-tuning on some system.
    The default value is 0.

name: net.topology.script.number.args
description:
The max number of args that the script configured with
    net.topology.script.file.name should be run with. Each arg is an
    IP address.

name: dfs.balancer.getBlocks.size
description:
Total size in bytes of Datanode blocks to get when fetching a source's
    block list.

name: dfs.namenode.max.objects
description:
The maximum number of files, directories and blocks
  dfs supports. A value of zero indicates no limit to the number
  of objects that dfs supports.

name: dfs.namenode.blocks.per.postponedblocks.rescan
description:
Number of blocks to rescan for each iteration of
    postponedMisreplicatedBlocks.
